newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore schools expel virtual pets - sources say.
newsitem.headline: Singapore schools expel virtual pets - sources say.

text.p: Most Singapore schools have banned Tamagotch computer pets from classrooms to keep students focused on their studies rather than the virtual reality toys, education sources said on Wednesday.
"Schools do ban them and I think all schools have," a source close the the Ministry of Education told Reuters.
The ministry declined immediate comment, but the sources said it had not issued an edict that the Tamagotch -- "loveable egg" in Japanese -- be officially excluded from school.
"As a general rule, principals have the power to decide," the source said.
The craze for the egg-shaped virtual reality toy has swept the world since its launch in Japan in early 1996 and has led Taiwan and Hong Kong to ban them in schools.
The Tamagotch demands too much attention, the Singapore sources said.
"Students spend more time on them than their studies," said one educationalist who declined to be identified.

The Tamagotch requires constant care as it is a toy which "evolves". Owners must entertain, educate and feed the Tamagotch as frequently as every hour or risk the toy throwing a tantrum, developing mood swings, or dying in extreme cases of neglect.
